results.title: The Naked Country
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Ross Dimsey, Filmways and Naked Country Productions
results.brief_description: An adaptation of the Morris West novel, set in spectacular scenery in the Northern Territory. John Stanton plays a station-master, whose inland journey involves him in a nightmare of violence, intrigue, tribal law and double-dealing. Directed by Burstall in his usual purple manner: plenty of gore, sex and colourful scenery. Cast includes John Stanton, Rebecca Gilling and Ivor Kants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tim Burstall, Ross Dimsey, Filmways and Naked Country Productions

results.title: The Naked civil servant
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, Barry Hanson and Thames Television
results.brief_description: This biographical film, based on the real life of Quentin Crisp, is briefly introduced by Crisp himself. Crisp is an effeminate homosexual, a flamboyant and witty exhibitionist whose conversation is as glittering as the lipstick and mascara he used to effect. The film, drawn from his own book, tells the story of his life: his youth in the 1930’s, his volatile relationship with his father, his ill-fated friendships, his encounters with authority in an extremely homophobic and intolerant society, and his rare moments of true happiness. Above all it tells the story of a good and honest man, determined to confront the world with the truth about himself, in order that they can learn to accept that he too is a human being with dreams and feelings just like everybody else. This is a witty and inspiring story of inner strength and fortitude, John Hurt was named Best Actor of 1975 at the British Academy Awards for his performance, and Jack Gold won the Academy’s Desmond Davis Award for his creative contribution to television.

results.title: The NABC's of basketball: the running game
results.brief_description: Coach Bill Foster organises the break into four major areas: the rebound, outlet, filling the lanes and completion of the break. Each phase of the break is developed in a two man series of fast break drills.

results.title: The NABC's of basketball: team defense - Bob Knight
results.brief_description: Coach Bob Knight breaks defence into two aspects: the side on which the ball in (ballside); and the side opposite the ball (helpside). Various drills are demonstrated that develop the individual skills necessary in a team defence.

results.title: The NABC's of basketball: individual offense
results.brief_description: Gene Bartow, Coach of the Year in 1973, relates the drills that his players use to develop individual offensive skills. Shows drills for guards, forwards and centres, as well as exercises for two-man situations.

results.title: The NABC's of basketball
results.brief_description: Five of America’s most respected and talented coaches analyse every aspect of the game of basketball. Lucius Mitchell examines the development of the big man; Bill Foster, the running game; Gene Barton relates the drills that his players use to develop individual offensive skills; Norm Stewart analyses the jump shot and one-hand free throw; Bobby Knight looks at team defence.

results.title: The Myths of shoplifting
results.creator_credit: Doug Jacoby, Doris Storm, Frank Jacoby, Churchill Films and M T I Teleprograms
results.brief_description: The increased incidence of shoplifting has meant increasingly sophisticated security and surveillance systems are installed in retail stores. The popular myths about shoplifting are examined and negated. This film contains six vignettes emphasising that shoplifting is a real crime with real consequences. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Myth of the Careless Worker
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Victorian Trades Hall Council
results.brief_description: This documentary/drama dispels the myth that industrial accidents are caused by careless workers, and the risks to the health and safety of workers are examined.

results.title: The Myth of the bush
results.creator_credit: Berry-Anne Billingsley, Open Learning Agency of Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Looks at the Heidelberg School of artists who are considered to be the first group of painters to capture the unique colours of the Australian landscape. Traces the artists’ history from their beginnings at Box Hill where Tom Roberts painted “Artists Camp”, to their first exhibition which concentrated on paintings executed at Heidelberg.

results.title: The Mystery of Oberwald = Il Mistero Di Oberwald
results.brief_description: Since her husband’s death ten years ago the Queen has been mournful, reclusive and obsessed with her own death. She offers refuge for three days to a man who attempts to kill her: she warns him ‘ If you do not kill me, I’ll kill you’. However, he bears a ghost-like resemblance to the dead king and quickly her passion and love for life is rekindled. The final twist in this remarkable picture will leave you drenched with compassion and only then will you know the mystery of Oberwald. From the play by Jean Cocteau.
